answers.author: Christine Thompson
answers.text:
I have a 'Wellness Scorecard' we used this year that I can send you.  However, the feedback was that it was overwhelming.  The goal was to earn points that correlated to dollar contributions to their HRA.  Next year, I am simplifying the process.  We are going to base quarterly HSA deposits on meeting a goal per quarter.  We are also considering a flat dollar contribution for additional activities.  Email me if you'd like me to forward you our documents. 
We have had a rough claims year so I wouldn't say it had a measurable impact this year.  I firmly believe I will have a significant impact in 2015.  
Good luck!

author: Gregory Preece
text:
Hello,
We are in the process of changing our city-wide health and wellness program to encourage more participation, as it has remained rather flat the past few years.  One idea we are strongly considering is awarding "health bucks" for participating in certain activities such as routinely working out, walking/running groups, health screening, etc.  The "bucks" could then be redeemed for prizes such as gift cards, rounds of golf, apparel and possibly a personal day, HSA or deferred compensation contribution, etc.
I am hoping other communities currently engaging in a similar program would be willing to share their program outline with us, specifically as it relates to earning/redeeming points and funding the program.
Thank you in advance.
title: Health & Wellness Program Incentives
